com.hcl.domino.richtext

Interface RichTextWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public interface RichTextWriter
extends AutoCloseable
    Writer to produce a new rich text item

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RichTextWriter.CaptionPosition
      Enum of available positions to place the caption of a file hotspot

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this resource, relinquishing any underlying resources. This method is invoked automatically on objects managed by the try-with-resources statement.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

        RichTextWriter addImage(Path imagePath)
        Adds an image from disk. We support BMP, JPG, GIF and PNG format.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - image filepath
        Returns:
        this writer

      • addImage

        RichTextWriter addImage(Path imagePath,
                        int resizeToWidth,
                        int resizeToHeight)
        Adds an image from disk. We support BMP, JPG, GIF and PNG format.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - image filepath
        resizeToWidth - if not -1, resize the image to this width
        resizeToHeight - if not -1, resize the image to this width
        Returns:
        this writer

        Adds an image from an input stream. We support BMP, JPG, GIF and PNG format.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this writer

                        int resizeToWidth,

        Adds an image from an input stream. We support BMP, JPG, GIF and PNG format.
        Parameters:

        resizeToWidth - if not -1, resize the image to this width
        resizeToHeight - if not -1, resize the image to this width
        Returns:
        this writer

      • addImageResource

        default RichTextWriter addImageResource(Path file)
                                 throws IOException
        Adds the provided stream as an image resource into this rich text writer.

        Note: this uses the structure of image-resource design elements and differs significantly from how inline images are handled. Use addImage(Path) and the related methods to add images to a UI rich-text field.

        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to the rich text buffer
        Returns:
        this writer
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file data
        Since:
        1.0.15

      • addImageResource

        RichTextWriter addImageResource(InputStream is,
                                long length)
                         throws IOException
        Adds the provided stream as an image resource into this rich text writer.

        If the length of the content is unknown, pass -1 for the length parameter. This is inefficient, however, as it will cause the underlying implementation to read the entire stream at the start instead of as needed.

        Note: this uses the structure of image-resource design elements and differs significantly from how inline images are handled. Use addImage(InputStream) and the related methods to add images to a UI rich-text field.

        Parameters:
        is - the InputStream to write to the rich text buffer
        length - the length of the file, if known; -1 otherwise
        Returns:
        this writer
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file data
        Since:
        1.0.15

      • addDocLink

        RichTextWriter addDocLink(Document doc,
                          String comment)
        This function inserts a DocLink for the specified Document.
        Parameters:
        doc - document to create the link
        comment - This string appears when the DocLink is selected (clicked on).
        Returns:
        this writer

      • addDocLink

        RichTextWriter addDocLink(String dbReplicaId,
                          String viewUnid,
                          String docUNID,
                          String comment)
        This function inserts a DocLink using manual values.
        Parameters:
        dbReplicaId - Replica ID of the database that contains the document pointed to by the DocLink.
        viewUnid - UNID of the DominoCollection that contains the document pointed to by the DocLink or null/empty string to create a database link
        docUNID - UNID of the document pointed to by the DocLink or null/empty string to create a view/collection link
        comment - This string appears when the DocLink is selected (clicked on).
        Returns:
        this writer

      • addFileResource

        default RichTextWriter addFileResource(Path file)
                                throws IOException
        Adds the provided file as a file resource into this rich text writer.

        Note: this uses the structure of file-resource design elements and differs significantly from how attachments are handled. Use addAttachmentIcon(Attachment, String) and the related methods to add attachments.

        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to the rich text buffer
        Returns:
        this writer
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file data
        Since:
        1.0.15

      • addFileResource

        RichTextWriter addFileResource(InputStream is,
                               long length)
                        throws IOException
        Adds the provided stream as a file resource into this rich text writer.

        If the length of the content is unknown, pass -1 for the length parameter. This is inefficient, however, as it will cause the underlying implementation to read the entire stream at the start instead of as needed.

        Note: this uses the structure of file-resource design elements and differs significantly from how attachments are handled. Use addAttachmentIcon(Attachment, String) and the related methods to add attachments to a rich-text field.

        Parameters:
        is - the InputStream to write to the rich text buffer
        length - the length of the file, if known; -1 otherwise
        Returns:
        this writer
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file data
        Since:
        1.0.15

      • addJavaScriptLibraryData

        RichTextWriter addJavaScriptLibraryData(String script)
        Adds the provided script as a JavaScript library block into this rich text writer.

        Note: this users the structure of script-library design elements and is not likely to be useful in UI rich text.

        Parameters:
        script - the content of the script to write
        Returns:
        this writer
        Since:
        1.0.15

      • addRichTextRecord

        <T extends RichTextRecord<?>> RichTextWriter addRichTextRecord(Class<T> recordClass,
                                                               Consumer<T> processor)
        Creates a new rich-text record of the given type and processes it through the provided function before appending it to the record stream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of record to add
        Parameters:
        recordClass - a Class record representing <T>
        processor - a Consumer to configure the record
        Returns:
        this writer

      • addRichTextRecord

        <T extends RichTextRecord<?>> RichTextWriter addRichTextRecord(Class<T> recordClass,
                                                               int variableDataLength,
                                                               Consumer<T> processor)
        Creates a new rich-text record of the given type and processes it through the provided function before appending it to the record stream.

        This method allows you to specify an additional amount of space to allocate for the structure's variable data, which will be accessible just after the final part of the structure.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of record to add
        Parameters:
        recordClass - a Class record representing <T>
        variableDataLength - the amount of additional space, in bytes, to allocate after the structure
        processor - a Consumer to configure the record
        Returns:
        this writer

      • createStructure

        <T extends MemoryStructure> T createStructure(Class<T> structureClass,
                                              int variableDataLength)
        Creates a new MemoryStructure of the given class in memory, without appending it to the destination rich-text entity. This is useful in specific situations where variable data consists of structured values.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of structure to create
        Parameters:
        structureClass - a Class representing <T>
        variableDataLength - the amount of additional space, in bytes, to allocate after the structure
        Returns:
        the newly-constructed structure

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Discard any changes in this writer and free all resources
